greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the eventual stable point reached when iterating k -> A097246(k), starting from k = n.
comment: a(n) = r(n,m) with m such that r(n,m)=r(n,m+1), where r(n,k) = A097246(r(n,k-1)), r(n,0)=n. (The original definition.)
The above remark could be interpreted to mean that A097249(n) <= a(n).
All terms are squarefree, and the squarefree numbers are the fixed points.
These are also fixed points eventually reached when iterating A277886.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If A008683(n) <> 0 [when n is squarefree], a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A097246(n)).
If A277885(n) = 0, a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A277886(n)).
a(1) = 1; a(p) = p, for prime p; a(m*k) = A331590(a(m), a(k)).
mathematica: Table[FixedPoint[Times @@ Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, Partition[#, 2, 2] &@ Flatten[FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e >= 2 :> {If[OddQ@ e, {p, 1}, {1, 1}], {NextPrime@ p, Floor[e/2]}}]] &, n], {n, 75}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 18 2017 *)
program: return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [(nextprime(i)**int(f[i]/2))*(i**(f[i]%2)) for i in f])
xref: A003961, A225546, A277885, A277886, A331590 are used to express relationship between terms of this sequence.
The formula section also details how the sequence maps the terms of A007913, A260443, A329050, A329332.
See comments/formulas in A283475, A283478, A331751 giving their relationship to this sequence.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 03 2004
ext: Name changed and the original definition moved to the Comments section by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 15 2016
